</div></td></tr><tr id="312457" class="odd"><td><div class="card-flag">
    
        <img src="/modules/flags/flags/svg/fra.svg">

    </div>


<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">AIR LIQUIDE ADVANCED TECHNOLOGIES</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 2a</span> C 212</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Air Liquide is a world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health. Present in 73 countries with approximately 67,100 employees, the Group serves more than 3.9 million customers and patients.&nbsp;With its strategic plan ADVANCE, Air Liquide places sustainability at the heart of its strategy, confirming its leadership in the decarbonization of the industry and in the emergence of a low-carbon society in which hydrogen plays a decisive part.<br>A major partner of civil and military aviation, Air Liquide designs and manufactures life-support equipment. Its protective breathing equipment (PBE) allow flight crews to breathe in case of polluted&nbsp; atmosphere (smoke on board, fire in the cabin, etc.) and are used by more than 300 airlines worldwide. The Group also designs and manufactures gas generation and distribution systems and storages, either on board aircraft for pilot or passengers or for ground support applications. Present across the entire hydrogen value chain, Air Liquide is capitalizing on its technical and industrial expertise in hydrogen to contribute to decarbonize aviation from the ground to the air. For aircraft as well as for airports, hydrogen could help cut emissions by 50% by 2050.<br>Committed to the space adventure for 60 years, Air Liquide started by accompanying the Ariane program in the early 1970s, designing and manufacturing more than 700 tanks to date. Its expertise also includes launch pad infrastructure, on-board cryogenic systems for satellites, and ground test equipment for launchers and satellites. The Group is innovating in the field of space exploration by developing energy generation and storage technologies, as well as air purification equipment, to support future projects and missions, in particular to the Moon and then Mars, for a sustainable human presence in Space. On the occasion of this new edition of Paris Air Show, Air Liquide will present its latest innovative solutions for the decarbonization of the aerospace industry and space exploration.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">Located in Belgium, AMOS has been designing and building high-performance optical and mechanical systems for more than 35 years. Its main achievements are a series of large-scale telescopes for professional astronomy, advanced &nbsp;space optics (mirrors, gratings, …) for more than 40 Earth Observation or Deep Space missions (Sentinel-2, 3 &amp; 5, Meteosat, Gaia, Rosetta, ExoMars, Bepi-Columbo …), test equipment for space instruments and high-precision mechanical equipment. This has been made possible thanks to a team of about 100 highly skilled and passionate engineers and researchers.</p>

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">APULIA REGION - DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 1</span> F 295</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Puglia, a dynamic region in the South-east of Italy, has emerged as one of the leading Italian regions in the aerospace sector, home to an industrial eco-system, consisting of c. 540 active companies, with a share of national sector exports in excess of 10%.&nbsp; Today, numerous international players operate in Puglia in diverse industrial specializations, making up the entire aerospace value chain (design, construction, assembly and testing of aircraft engines, design and construction of aerostructures and light aircraft in carbon fibre, software design, microsatellites and propulsion systems, Earth observation and space data management systems). Regione Puglia actively promotes the regional aerospace industry in major international markets and supports innovation and growth across the sector, making available a wide range of incentives for business investments, through Puglia Sviluppo S.p.A., the regional development agency which is on hand to provide backing to investors, guiding them step by step through the investment process.</p>

    
    <div class="card-pictos-container">  
        
    </div>

We make great software and hardware.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">ATR is the world number one regional aircraft manufacturer, with its ATR 42 and 72 turboprops the best-selling aircraft in the less than 90-seat market segment. The unifying vision of the company’s employees is to accelerate sustainable connections for people, communities and businesses around the world, no matter how remote, by delivering and supporting the most efficient, lowest emission and advanced regional aircraft on the market. Thanks to the efficiency of turboprop technology and the benefits of ATR’s focus on continuous innovation, ATR aircraft open 140 new routes every year on average, burn 45% less fuel and emit 45% less CO2 than similar-size regional jets. Fully committed to the decarbonisation of aviation, ATR was the first manufacturer to fly a commercial aircraft with 100% Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) in both engines, and aims for the 100% SAF certification of its aircraft family by 2025.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">After years of continuous R&amp;D investment, <b>Bmax</b> is positioned in the aerospace market as a key player in the manufacture and assembly of complex metal parts using various processes based on a disruptive technology: High Pulsed Power&nbsp;(HPP).<br><br><b>Bmax</b> technology is based on a high concentration of electrical energy used to set the metal in motion at extremely high deformation speeds.<br><br><b>Bmax</b> thus offers new production possibilities with its innovative, clean and exceptionally efficient technology, as well as new engineering and design possibilities.&nbsp;<br><br>Our value proposition for the Aerospace industry is based on 3 major axes :&nbsp;<br>- an offer of digital simulation for our processes, unique in the industry<br>- an offer of manufacturing &amp; assembly of aerospace parts with high added value in our Toulouse workshop&nbsp;<br>- an offer of design and supply of integrated HPP production machines for our customers</p>

                <img loading="lazy" class="card-picto" src="https://liste-exposants.hubj2c.com/upload/bourg_photo/picto_64522271d3892_startair.png" title="StartAir by GIFAS">
                    
    </div>

</div></td></tr><tr id="310586" class="even"><td><div class="card-flag">
    
        <img src="/modules/flags/flags/svg/fra.svg">

    </div>


<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">CFM INTERNATIONAL</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Chalet</span> 147</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">CFM: The Power of Flight CFM <br><br>International (CFM), a 50/50 joint company between GE Aerospace and Safran Aircraft Engines, is the world’s leading supplier of commercial transport aircraft engines and the best example of a successful international joint venture. <br><br>The agreement that established CFM calls for the two parent companies to share everything equally, from design and development to production and support. Final engine assembly is performed both at GE facilities in Lafayette, Indiana, and Durham, North Carolina in the U.S., and at Safran facilities in Villaroche, France. <br><br>Since the first engine was delivered in 1982, CFM has received orders for more than 51,350 CFM56 and LEAP engines from some 600+ operators worldwide, of which more than 40,000 engines have been delivered. CFM currently produces the advanced LEAP engine family to power the Airbus A320neo, the Boeing 737 MAX, and the COMAC C919. <br><br>Since the first LEAP engines entered revenue service in August 2016, the fleet has demonstrated world-class daily utilization rates while delivering a 15 to 20+ percent improvement in fuel efficiency, along with significant reductions in noise and emissions signatures. To date, the fleet has logged a total of more than&nbsp;30 million engine flight hours.<br><br> The CFM Services organization, which was launched in 2008, focuses on providing world-class aftermarket products and programs, working with customers to meet their unique, evolving needs from entry-into-service to mid-life through maturity and retirement. <br><br>In June 2021, GE and Safran launched the CFM RISE (Revolutionary Innovation for Sustainable Engines) Technology Demonstration Program as a manifestation of the deep commitment they share for achieving ambitious goals for a sustainable future. The program embodies CFM’s mission to push the limits of innovation to develop, demonstrate, and bring to market breakthrough technologies that will help protect the planet. <br><br>Technologies matured as part of the RISE Program will serve as the foundation for the next generation CFM engine that could be available by the mid-2030s. Program goals include reducing fuel consumption and CO2 emissions by more than 20 percent compared to today’s most efficient engines, as well as ensuring compatibility with alternative energy sources like Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAF) and hydrogen. The program will deliver revolutionary performance all while maintaining the unrivaled CFM standards for reliability, asset utilization, and overall cost of ownership.</p>

            <div class="card-image-container">
            <div class="card-image" style="background-image: url(https://liste-exposants.hubj2c.com/upload/bourg_photo/visuelRedim/310586_logo_CFM_logo_Core_color.png);"></div>
        </div>
    
    <div class="card-pictos-container">  
        
    </div>

    <p class="card-text-container">For the last 60 years, CNES has played a pivotal role in the French, European and international space arena. It helps the French government to shape and execute its space strategy, and to implement public policies to which the space sector is called on to contribute.&nbsp;The agency is thus instrumental in maintaining France’s independence, notably through the national military space strategy; it promotes the excellence of the French scientific community worldwide and delivers data crucial to gain new insights into the Earth system and adapt to climate change; and it is fuelling the wider economy and playing a vital role honing our competitive edge.&nbsp;To meet these challenges, <b>CNES is active in 5 main areas</b>: launchers and space transportation, science and space exploration, Earth observation, telecommunications and applications, and defence.</p>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Chalet</span> 47</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Constellium is a world leader in the development and manufacture of high-value added aluminium products and solutions. Constellium’s mission is to meet customer’s and society’s need for lightweight, efficiency, and sustainability.&nbsp;<br><br>Constellium helps aerospace manufacturers maintain cruising speed with value-added aluminium plates, sheets, and extrusions, for the commercial, military, and space markets. Constellium is a major partner of aircraft manufacturers all over the world, and our high-performance technologies are behind the development, design, and manufacture of the next generation of aircraft. We work with the industry’s designers, assemblers, and suppliers to make commercial aircraft even more lightweight, efficient, affordable, and reliable. Our groundbreaking Airware® solution makes us the undisputed leader in aluminium-lithium technology.<br><br>Constellium, with a privileged metal supplier position in Aerospace and decades of knowledge in rapid solidification metallurgy, has developed two revolutionary additive manufacturing alloys that fit the needs of this technology-driven industry.&nbsp;Aheadd® powder alloys (CP1, HT1) are optimized for the additive manufacturing Laser Powder Bed Fusion process, best suited to print high-performance, complex parts which are impossible to produce with conventional techniques, opening new possibilities for aluminum applications.</p>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 2c</span> B 342</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Providing reliable, safe and secure space services is our daily business - and our passion. We are responsible for managing Europe´s biggest spacecraft constellation: the European Satellite Navigation System GALILEO. On behalf of the European Commission, we operate from our headquarters at the Galileo Control Center (GCC-D) in Oberpfaffenhofen, Germany.<br><br>Thanks to the technical infrastructure we have implemented, we ensure 99,99% service availability. DLR GfR’s constellation operations services at GCC-D comprise 24/7 routine operations and maintenance the Galileo satellites and of the related ground segment infrastructure. From GCC-D we organise the operation of the globally distributed Galileo infrastructure, both on-ground and in-orbit, throughout all mission phases. This includes mission planning and flight dynamics services, efficient team training and management, reliable configuration monitoring and global service-level tracking and monitoring.<br><br>With our international team of more than 250 experts, we offer our customers excellent service and navigate the Galileo project with foresight into the future.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">Specialized in Environmental Intelligence, Ellona provides real-time enriched environmental data for outdoor and indoor spaces. The company brings together a unique expertise on odors, air quality, noise, and light pollution, signatures, and data science. Inspired by humans, we digitize human senses and develop complex signatures to characterize the perceived environmental atmosphere using an end-to-end solution (from IoT to data science). Our solutions enable control, identify, alert, regulate, and initiate remedial actions. They thus help decision-makers to improve their environments through the use of sensors capable of analyzing and monitoring air quality and nuisances. They therefore make it possible to optimize, in the field of aeronautics, for example, the monitoring of production plants, predictive maintenance, safety, monitoring of emissions in aircraft, etc.<br><br>www.ellona.io</p>

We qualify electric and hydrogen powertrains: engine, battery, fuel cell, etc.<br><br>The Emitech Group also supports you throughout the design stages of your electronic, mechanical and mechatronic systems and propulsion systems, through its engineering and training services. The Emitech Group also produces all types of test benches to specific specifications.<br><br>Inaugurated in 2023: new EMC cage of 27*18*11m.</p>

<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">FN HERSTAL</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 2b</span> G 51</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">FN Herstal are world leaders in the provision of advanced defence systems for multi-role military helicopters and subsonic aircraft. Its end-to-end services cover design, development, manufacture, and full integration of airborne weapon systems with unequalled firing capabilities, ease of use and crew safety. The company is ISO 9001 and AS /EN 9100 certified.<b><br><br></b>FN Herstal’s portfolio includes integrated airborne crew served weapon solutions and fixed-forward firing solutions designed around FN® machine guns, rocket launchers and a complete range of ammunition.<br><br>Airborne crew served weapon solutions can be window-, door-, ramp-, or externally mounted, and feature the 7.62x51mm FN MAG® machine gun or world exclusive .50 cal FN M3M® machine gun.<br>Airborne fixed-forward firing solutions are available in various configurations depending on the ammunition box capacity, and requirement for links/cases collector and optional 2.75’’ rocket launcher tubes. These systems are available with a comprehensive FN® airborne digital suite to meet challenging market demands and expectations on integrating machine guns and rocket launchers into modern platforms.<br><br>The FN® airborne digital suite includes a FN® D-HUD targeting solution, a FN® D-PC pod controller and a self-contained FN® D-Pod digital pod.<br>Over its long history, FN Herstal has reinforced its reputation for world leading defence solutions for military agencies and vehicle and aircraft manufacturers. With its integrated airborne weapon systems already fitted to over 5,200 carriers, FN Herstal is a brand trusted by military and security forces around the globe.</p>

    
    <div class="card-pictos-container">  
        
    </div>

</div></td></tr><tr id="378088" class="odd"><td><div class="card-flag">

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 2b</span> G 94</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Fokker Services Group is an independent aviation aftermarket company with a global reach. Providing comprehensive solutions from its five facilities in Europe, Asia and the Americas, Fokker Services Group is a key partner for regional, narrow-body and wide-body platforms in the Commercial, VIP, Cargo and Defense markets. The organization offers a unique set of capabilities, products and services: ‘Modifications &amp; Engineering Services’ for the latest technical solutions; ‘Component &amp; Material Services’ such as nose-to-tail programs, exchange services, component repairs, parts manufacturing and spares deliveries; ‘Airframe Services’ for aircraft MRO including lease transitions and painting; and ‘Aircraft Completion &amp; Conversion Services’ for Executive, VVIP and Special Mission aircraft upgrades. With this broad range of expertise, Fokker Services Group ensures the continued competitive operation of its customers’ fleet.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">Fort Wayne Metals manufactures precision wire-based materials and components that assist in the performance of aerospace applications. For more than 50 years, Fort Wayne Metals has been providing exceptional quality, reliability, and technical expertise in the custom manufacturing of wire, bar, strands, cables, shape-set parts, actuator wire, and mechanical assemblies. These highly engineered products are used across the aerospace industry in everything from engine components, valves, and landing gear springs, as well as in the medical industry, specifically cardiovascular applications, neurostimulation devices, dental implants, and many other critical applications. Some of Fort Wayne Metals' core capabilities include the melting and processing of shape memory alloys, including Nitinol, in a variety of product forms. Additionally, the company creates innovative solutions by streamlining customers' production steps with value-added services, including boutique melting for R&amp;D alloys, coating, laser ablation, accredited testing services, prototyping, and research and development support. G &amp; S Bar and Wire, a Fort Wayne Metals company, provides expanded capabilities to support highly demanding applications by custom producing centerless ground bar, strain hardened bar, clad metal profiles, and weld wire.</p>

DLR uses the expertise of its 55 research institutes and facilities to develop solutions to these challenges. Our 10,000 employees share a mission - to explore Earth and space and develop technologies for a sustainable future. In doing so, DLR contributes to strengthening Germany’s position as a prime location for research and industry.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">Since 2018, 4 territories located at the north eastern part of Paris Region - Roissy Pays de France, Pays de l'Ourcq, Plaines et Monts de France and Pays de Meaux - funded a Public Interest Group called Roissy Meaux Aéropôle (RMA) in order to gather their strengths. The whole area represents more than 500,000 inhabitants and more than 110,000 jobs. GIP RMA’s aims is to develop its strategic areas by bringing together planning, economic development, employment, training and mobility policies. In addition, GIP RMA also aims to boost its network in the whole aeronautics, airport and air sector which is considered as essential within the economic diversification of the area in an overall context of green transition (sustainable development/energy).</p>

    </div>


<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">GKN AEROSPACE</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Chalet</span> 383</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">GKN Aerospace is the world’s leading multi-technology tier 1 aerospace supplier, with a mission to be the most trusted and sustainable partner in the sky. As a global company serving the world’s leading aircraft manufacturers, GKN Aerospace designs, manufactures and delivers an extensive range of advanced aerospace systems, components and technologies – for use in commercial and defence aircraft ranging from helicopters, business jets, passenger planes and advanced air mobility vehicles to the most advanced fighter aircraft. In line with its mission, GKN Aerospace is committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050. Lightweight composites, additive manufacturing, electrical wiring interconnection systems and innovative engine systems help to reduce emissions and weight on today’s aircraft, while it collaborates with global partners to accelerate the development of zero-emission aircraft technologies, including hydrogen-powered propulsion and all-electric flight. GKN Aerospace is market leading in aerostructures and engine systems, with 15,000 employees across its 38 manufacturing locations in 12 countries.<b> &nbsp;</b></p>

In 2022, the group handled through its brand Paris Aéroport 86.7 million passengers at Paris-Charles de Gaulle and Paris-Orly, and nearly 193.7 million passengers in airports abroad. Boasting an exceptional geographic location and a major catchment area, the Group is pursuing its strategy of adapting and modernizing its terminal facilities and upgrading quality of services; the group also intends to develop its retail and real estate businesses. In 2022, group revenue stood at €4,688 million and net income at €516million.<br>Registered office: 1, rue de France, 93 290 Tremblay-en-France.     <p class="card-text-container">With more than 350 employees in France and Morocco, we support you in the aeronautics, railway, EMS and defense: HALGAND (contact@halgand.com) is recognized in the mechanical trades. Its performance is based on state-of-the-art equipment, and combines our expertise in milling, turning, industrial &amp; aeronautical boilermaking (rolling, shot blasting), assembly of structural sub-assemblies, and Surface Treatment.<br> HALMES Morocco is dedicated to Milling (3 &amp; 5 axes). SMPT (commercial@smpt.fr) is a specialist in small-scale precision milling in the field of Electronic Manufacturing Services, Aeronautical Systems, prototyping and assembly of sub-assemblies. Our references: AIRBUS–LISI–SAFRAN–THALES-ALSTOM-HUTCHINSON–DAHER–DASSAULT-SONACA-MECACHROME–ADF</p>

    
    <div class="card-pictos-container">  
        
    </div>

</div></td></tr><tr id="378941" class="odd"><td><div class="card-flag">
    
        <img src="/modules/flags/flags/svg/usa.svg">

    </div>


<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">HALLIDAY TECHNOLOGIES</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 3</span> D 162</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Halliday Technologies has designed and manufactured friction equipment for 30 years. We serve airports globally, including 60 US airports. The RT3® Flight Friction Tester accurately measures pavement surface friction with repeatable results. Airfield Operations can measure surface friction quickly and efficiently, minimizing runway downtime. The data is used to determine&nbsp;where to remove rubber, how the surface friction characteristics have changed, and how to optimize friction while reducing chemical usage in winter.</p>

With close to 50 years of expertise and over 400 equipment sold worldwide Bernex is an undisputed leader in the field CVD, CVA and CVI coating equipment and technologies. Our 3D gas vacuum process is the right solution when looking for coatings applied to aeronautics complex shaped components such as hot section turbine blades and vanes or CMC fiber with application coating such as Aluminum diffusion coatings HTLA CVA (β NiAl phase) or BN, SiC and Pyrolytic Carbon coatings.<br><br>Hauzer has been a pioneer in plasma coating equipment since 1983. Creative solutions are part of our DNA. Our engineers have used their experience to develop a broad plasma technology portfolio, which we integrate in our industrial batch and inline equipment.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">Lilium (NASDAQ: LILM) is creating a sustainable and accessible mode of high-speed, regional transportation for people and goods. Using the Lilium Jet, an all-electric vertical take-off and landing jet, offering leading capacity, low noise, and high performance with zero operating emissions, Lilium is accelerating the decarbonization of air travel. Working with aerospace, technology, and infrastructure leaders, and with planned launch networks announced in Germany, the United States, Brazil, and the United Kingdom, Lilium’s 800+ strong team includes approximately 450 aerospace engineers and a leadership team responsible for delivering some of the most successful aircraft in aviation history. Founded in 2015, Lilium’s headquarters and manufacturing facilities are in Munich, Germany, with teams based across Europe and the U.S. To learn more, visit www.lilium.com.</p>

    </div>

    </div>

</div></td></tr><tr id="379014" class="odd"><td><div class="card-flag">
    
        <img src="/modules/flags/flags/svg/lux.svg">

    </div>


<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">LUXEMBOURG INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY (LIST)</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 2b</span> E 48</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">The Luxembourg Institute of Science and Technology (LIST) is a mission-driven Research and Technology Organisation (RTO) active in the fields of materials, space, environment and IT.<br><br>LIST’s Materials department is leading an Innovation Program focused on Sustainable and Lightweight Composite Materials. The Sustainable Composite Materials &amp; Manufacturing (SCMM) Innovation Centre focuses its Research and Technology Developments on the challenges in transport sectors towards zero‐emission mobility solutions. The initiative is endorsed by large OEMs in the automotive, rail, aeronautic and space sectors, which steer the centre’s vision and drive the R&amp;T roadmap. In this context, SCMM develops innovative composite materials and processes and aims at delivering demonstrators, meeting the expectations of industrial partners. The technology bricks are developed in close collaboration with academic and industrial partners, all along the composites value chain. The program is co-funded by the Luxembourg’s Ministry of Economy and Ministry of Higher Education and Research. &nbsp;<br><br>LIST's Environmental Research<br> and Innovation department includes the Remote Sensing and natural resources modelling group which is carrying out impact-driven research, geared towards monitoring and predicting environmental systems in a changing world.&nbsp; Research activities focus on the synergistic use, processing, and interpretation of data from multiple complementary active and passive sensors installed on both space- and airborne platforms. The group integrate remotely sensed information with in-situ data, process-based models and leverage satellite communication, IoT and machine learning technologies in order to provide evidence-based decision support tools across a variety of thematic domains: disaster risk reduction, precision agriculture and viticulture, preservation and management of natural resources, maritime surveillance, humanitarian aid and defence.</p>

    
    <div class="card-pictos-container">  
        
    </div>

    <p class="card-text-container"><i>Martin-Baker is located at Booth F140 where we are exhibiting our latest ejection and crashworthy seats.<br><br></i><i>Martin-Baker is the world’s longest established and most experienced developer of ejection seats with 17,000 seats in-service today, fitted to 70 aircraft types, flying with 117 operators across 83 countries. Backed by 78 years of continuous development, Martin-Baker has saved the lives of 7,691 aircrew worldwide. <br><br></i><i>Our range of crashworthy seats incorporate energy attenuation systems for both rotary and fixed wing aircraft.     <div class="card-stand"><div title="Chalet 65,  Hall 2a C 254"><span class="card-hall">Chalet</span> 65</div><b class="dots">...</b></div>

    <p class="card-text-container">MTU Aero Engines AG is Germany's leading engine manufacturer. The company is a technological leader in low-pressure turbines, high-pressure compressors, turbine center frames as well as manufacturing processes and repair techniques. In the commercial OEM business, the company plays a key role in the development, manufacturing and marketing of high-tech components together with international partners. Some 30 percent of today’s active aircraft in service worldwide have MTU components on board. In the commercial maintenance sector the company ranks among the top 3 service providers for commercial aircraft engines and industrial gas turbines. The activities are combined under the roof of MTU Maintenance. In the military arena, MTU Aero Engines is Germany's industrial lead company for practically all engines operated by the country's military. MTU operates a network of locations around the globe; Munich is home to its corporate headquarters. In fiscal 2022, the company had a workforce of more than 11,000 employees and posted consolidated sales of 5.3 billion euros.</p>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 3</span> E 124</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is a Government of Canada research and development (R&amp;D) organization. Composed of 14 research centres, including the Aerospace Research Centre, the NRC partners with industry to take research impacts from the lab to the marketplace, where people can experience the benefits.<br><br>The NRC’s unique expertise and facilities dedicated to aerospace R&amp;D help businesses, academia and other government organizations, in Canada and internationally, overcome product development and certification challenges. Our 350+ aerospace researchers are focused on 8 key areas:<br><br>- Advanced air mobility<br>- Aerospace manufacturing and automation<br>- Air travel research<br>- Climate resilience and space<br>- Defence and sustainment<br>- Digital twins and virtual testing<br>- Icing and safety<br>- Sustainable aviation</p>

    
    <div class="card-pictos-container">  
        
    </div>

    <p class="card-text-container">For more than a century, Nexans has been providing its customers with state-of-the-art cabling infrastructures for the transmission of energy and data. Today, beyond cables, the Group advises, designs solutions and services that optimize its customers' performance and the efficiency of their projects, from energy and telecom networks to energy resources and transportation. Nearly half of all commercial aircraft are now equipped with Nexans cables: aeronautical engineers regularly choose Nexans cables because the company has a proven track record of providing advanced solutions that reduce weight while improving safety and reliability. Through our commitment to excellence, we live up to our leadership position in commercial and military applications. Nexans offers the most complete range of aeronautical wires and cables on the market, compliant with European ASD-EN, American AS22759 and AS27500 standards, as well as customer specifications (ABS, BMS, ESW, ASNE …). With an industrial presence in 34 countries and commercial activities around the world, Nexans employs nearly 25,000 people.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">Norsk Titanium is a global leader in metal 3D printing, innovating the future of metal manufacturing by enabling a paradigm shift to a clean and sustainable manufacturing process. With its proprietary Rapid Plasma Deposition®&nbsp;(RPD®) technology and 700 MT of production capacity, Norsk Titanium offers cost-efficient 3D printing of value-added metal parts to a large addressable market. RPD®&nbsp;printed parts are already flying on commercial aircraft, and Norsk Titanium has gained significant traction with large defense and industrial customers.</p>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 2c</span> C 328</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">LITEF is one of the leading companies in the development and manufacturing of navigation and sensor systems. The company's expertise is based on German technology for mechanical, fibre optic and micro-electro-mechanical inertial sensors. This enables ITAR-free distribution of LITEF products around the globe. <br>Founded in 1961 and headquartered in Freiburg im Breisgau (Germany), the product range includes sensors, inertial measurement units, attitude and heading reference systems, inertial navigation systems and inertial reference systems. In close dialogue with the customer, specific product solutions are developed for measurement and navigation tasks, with maximum precision and reliability requirements. <br>LITEF products are in use worldwide with applications ranging from civil and military aviation, land and marine applications to industrial solutions.</p>

The program started in 2018 and the first prototype was released in December 2020. An&nbsp;amphibian aircraft prototype has been manufactured and made its 1st&nbsp;flight in March 2022. The Company is also working on a 4 pax version and on a full electric vertical take-off and landing (e_VTOL) configuration.&nbsp;NOVOTECH has developed significant know-how in the field of production of structural parts with composite materials through automated and out of autoclave production processes (AFP, PCM, CF, RTM and LRI).&nbsp;</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">Progressive Technology is a privately owned, vertically integrated precision machining, metal additive manufacturing and composites manufacturer specialising in rapid &nbsp;prototyping and short batch production for aerospace, defence, space, medical and motorsport.It offers one of the largest range of machining capabilities within a single business in the UK and possibly Europe.It offers manufacturing&nbsp; solutions for printed metal parts in aluminium, titanium, super alloys and composites. &nbsp;Other significant &nbsp;in-house capabilities include - heat treatment, test laboratory, NDT, laser &amp; touch CMM, tooling, jig and fixture, CNC grinding, extrude honing, plating &amp; anodisingWith a turnover of over €30m with 220 employees.     <p class="card-text-container">Nouvelle-Aquitaine has more than 500 industrial establishments in aeronautics and space sectors with many flagships sustaining a network of dynamic and efficient SME’s. The Region's ambition is to build a competitive, innovative, carbon-free and sustainable industry in its territory, from factory to use.</p>

            <div class="card-image-container">
            <div class="card-image" style="background-image: url(https://liste-exposants.hubj2c.com/upload/bourg_photo/visuelRedim/371274_logo_logo_na_vertical_QUADRI_2019002.png);"></div>
        </div>

    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">RÉGION OCCITANIE</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 4</span> E 176</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Welcome to Occitanie, a dynamic region located in the south of France. Home to a diverse range of industries and a talented workforce, Occitanie offers numerous opportunities for business and investment.&nbsp;In addition to its world-renowned aerospace industry, Occitanie boasts thriving sectors in biotechnology, renewable energy, and agribusiness. With a strong focus on innovation and sustainability, these industries are driving economic growth and creating jobs throughout the region.&nbsp;Occitanie is also a hub of research and development, with top-notch universities and research centers dedicated to advancing cutting-edge technologies and solving the challenges of the future.&nbsp;Thanks to its strategic location, Occitanie offers excellent connectivity and an easy access to global markets.</p>

Lazio is a Land of Space due to companies with high technical skills and highest quality manufacturing systems: more than&nbsp;230 companies&nbsp;among large, small and medium sized and startups; about&nbsp;23,500 employees; an&nbsp;annual turnover of more than 5 billion euro&nbsp;(of which 1.6 billion for export); 10 primary research bodies, 5 universities with 4 engineering departments and about 30 post-degree courses; 3,000 among university professors, researchers and other experts involved in research activities; incubators, such as&nbsp;ESA-BIC Incubator; science and technology parks.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">SAFE is a French competitiveness cluster dedicated to aerospace industry, as well as defence and security. Thanks to the support of Region SUD, where it is based, it federates more than 500 members who rely on it for innovation support, industrial cooperation, collaborations with academics as well as end-users, and business development. Its key activity sectors are Helicopters, unmanned vehicles, counter-drone solutions, electric aviation, satellite industry and the spatial data applications. SAFE leads and structures as well the development of the airships and lighter than air industry. Come over and join us! Hall 4 - B78</p>

Thus, calibration laboratories (AMS2750 and COFRAC) and on-site control services have progressively expanded its activities.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">SkyDrive was formally established in July 2018 after testing flying car concepts and prototypes from 2014 with the mission of “taking the lead in the once-in-a-century mobility revolution.” Its vision is to create a future where everyone has access to eVTOLs as their daily transportation in Japan and across the world. The company succeeded in the first crewed flight test in Japan in 2019 and its eVTOL “SD-05” is in the process of acquiring its Japan Civil Aviation Bureau (JCAB) certification. SkyDrive has been selected as a company to participate in the Advanced Air Mobility (AAM) project at Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, Japan.</p>

    
    <div class="card-pictos-container">  
        
    </div>

    <p class="card-text-container">A owned subsidiary of Dassault Aviation, Sogitec is a French leader in aeronautical training and simulation systems, Sogitec contributes to the development, maintenance and improvement of the operational capability of pilots, crews and maintenance personnel of the armed forces, in France and abroad.<br>Sogitec is a prime contractor for national and international complex programs involving multiple industrial cooperations. Thanks to its experience and its investment, innovation and development capacities, Sogitec is growing in France and internationally in the training simulation markets.<br>Sogitec develops, produces, markets and supports a comprehensive and coherent range of products and services for the simulation needs of Mirage and Rafale aircraft, NH90 and H160M (HIL - Guépard) helicopters, UAS, mission aircraft as well as Falcon business jets.<br>A owned subsidiary of Dassault Aviation, Sogitec is based in Suresnes (92) and Bruz (35).</p>

The company's vision is to fly in areas where it has not been possible before. With its innovative technology, Tensor aims to establish efficient and environmentally friendly airborne locomotion that is independent of infrastructure on the ground. The Tensor Gyroplanes are designed for three possible applications: professional use, personal mobility and cargo transport.</p>

<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant gras-rouge">TOFFEEAM</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 2b</span> F 139</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">TOffeeAM revolutionizes the Aerospace industry by providing a powerful design tool that allows users to approach the design process with physics-driven techniques. Our software, which operates on the cloud, is designed to optimize the design and production of Thermo-fluid and structural components. The tool, which is multi-objective and multi-physics, automates the design and optimization process, maximizing component performance. TOffeeAM, which stands for Topology Optimization for Fluids Engineering for Advanced Manufacturing, enables users to create unique solutions in a matter of minutes or hours, rather than days or months. The process is effortless, requiring only the design space, fluid and material properties, and the desired performance objectives. TOffeeAM's capabilities reduce design and production time, making it a valuable asset to the aerospace industry</p>

<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 3</span> B 148</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Washington State has been at the forefront of innovation in the aviation and aerospace industry for more than a century. Leveraging a dense supply chain of 1,500+ companies and elite workforce of 130,000+, the ecosystem drives innovation and collaboration that continues to dominate the global market.&nbsp;<br><br>Facing one of humanity’s greatest threats – climate change – Washington’s industry is leading the charge to green and sustainable aviation. With a rapidly growing list of promising companies, new and gamechanging technologies in the realm of hydrogen, electric and hybrid hydrogen-electric propulsion systems are making promising inroads on small commuter, private and short-range commercial aircraft. Initial tests have been conducted on retrofitted fossil-fuel aircraft, but new ground-up designs are emerging from factory floors and undergoing flight trials. Using its abundance of feedstock and energy infrastructure, the state is in an excellent position to produce sustainable aviation fuel.<br><br> Innovation is embedded in Washington State’s DNA. Through a Clean Energy Fund and Innovation Cluster Acceleration Program, the state is investing in new opportunities and green technologies to meet the industry’s aggressive decarbonization goals. Thanks to a strong history of industry collaboration across several target sectors, including advanced manufacturing, clean technology, and ICT, the state is well-positioned for the arrival of Industry 4.0. Robotics, additive manufacturing, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cybersecurity, quantum computing and a host of interrelated disciplines will reduce risk and the development and production timeframe for new aircraft and subsequent iterations. Washington State has been the natural choice for aerospace and aviation companies for the past century and is the premier landing pad as companies launch into the next century.</p>

Since 1939 Zephyr has supplied the Aerospace Industry with top quality tools "Engineered to Perform". Zephyr Tool Group`s brands include Kwik-Lok® temporary fasteners, Zephyr Industrial® screwdriver bits &amp; power tool accessories, Lok-Fast® installation &amp; removal tools, Martin Aircraft Tools, and Zephyr Aerospace® tools for hole preparation and hole fastening. Zephyr proudly manufactures all its tools in the USA.</p>

    <p class="card-text-container">ZOLLERN Investment Casting will present at Paris Airshow its new production capabilities in DS / SX &amp; EQX Castings - starting from Q2 / 2023.<br><br>The new equipment will enable ZOLLERN to support its existing customer base and grow its business within Aerospace sectors in the coming years.<br><br><b>Product portfolio &amp; technical data<br></b>- EQX components up to 1000 mm (40 “) in diameter and 1000 mm (40 “) in height<br>- DS / SX components up to 600 mm length (23,5 “)<br>- Melt capacity from 10 kg to 220 kg (22 to 485 lbs)<br>- Nickel-based superalloys, such as:<br>Equiaxed&nbsp;(EQX): IN100, IN738LC, IN939, IN792, René 80, René 77, MAR-M247LC<br>Directionally solidified (DS): MAR-M200 +Hf, MAR-M247LC, GTD-111, René 142<br>Single crystal (SX): CMSX-4, PWA 1480, René N5<br><br><b>European Supply Chain&nbsp;<br></b>ZOLLERN can help to support EU's strategic autonomy in the aerospace industry with its European based production facilities. From its alloy production in Slovenia through to the new DS / SX Components Production in its Headquarters in Germany, then on to its finishing facility in Romania we can offer the full band to our international aerospace customer.</p>

    </div>


<div class="card-celluleExposant">

    
    <div class="">

        <div class="card-nomExposant ">ZOPPAS INDUSTRIES HEATING ELEMENT TECHNOLOGIES</div>

    </div>

    <div class="card-stand"><span class="card-hall">Hall 1</span> FG 328</div>

    <p class="card-text-container">Zoppas Industries Heating Element Technologies is an Italian designer and manufacturer of flexible heaters for space applications, ESA-qualified since 1992. ZIHET flexible heaters are produced by an etching process, delivering a thin and lightweight solution. Some key features: fully customizable shapes, precise track layout, very high operating temperature (200°C), small bending radius, easy installation with optional PSA, optimized heat transfer with optional Aluminum backing, very high ohmic density. ZIHET Flexible heaters are integrated on small to large satellites, constellations, pressurized modules, launch vehicles, ground stations and testing equipment, covering from COTS to flight qualified applications.</p>
